law.catch_line: Procedure for correction of errors in issuance of certificates.

text.section:
Sec. 10-17. Procedure for correction of errors in issuance of certificates.
Notwithstanding the provisions of the foregoing sections, when any certificate of competency shall have been issued or shall be outstanding because of error of law or of fact, or because of administrative error, the Board may revoke or correct such certificate upon notice and reasonable opportunity to be heard, but without charges, findings, or other formal requirements, and failure to return such certificate to the Board upon demand therefor shall be a violation of this chapter.
Further, and notwithstanding the provisions of the foregoing sections, the Board may correct an error of law, or of fact, or an administrative error which resulted in the denial of the issuance of a proper certificate of competency whether such error was the result of the action of the current Board or of a prior Miami-Dade County Examining Board.
